text: 何これ / 解析不能を示すコードナンバー
translation: What's this? / A code number indicating analysis impossible.
grammar: を示す - particle を + verb 示す (to show/indicate) creates 'indicating/showing X' pattern

text: つまりわけわかんないってこと / そう 使徒は粒子と波 両方の性質を備える光のようなもので構成されているのよ
translation: In other words, we don't understand it at all. / Right. The Angel is composed of something like light that has properties of both particles and waves.
grammar: わけわかんない - casual contraction of わけがわからない (doesn't make sense). ～ている - continuous/state form indicating ongoing condition

text: で 動力源はあったんでしょ / らしきものはね でもその作動原理がまださっぱりなのよ / まだまだ未知の世界が広がってるわけね
translation: So there was a power source, right? / Something like that, yes. But we still have no idea about its operating principle. / So there's still a vast unknown world ahead of us.
grammar: ～んでしょ - casual form of ～のでしょう (right?/isn't it?). さっぱり with の indicates 'completely unknown/unclear'

text: とかくこの世は謎だらけよ / 例えば ほら この使徒独自の固有波形パターン
translation: In any case, this world is full of mysteries. / For example, look, this unique waveform pattern of the Angel.
grammar: ～だらけ - suffix meaning 'full of, covered with' (often negative connotation)

text: どれどれ
translation: Let me see.
grammar: Repetition of question word どれ for casual exclamatory effect

text: これって / そう / 構成素材の違いはあっても / 信号の配置と座標は / 人間の遺伝子と酷似しているわ / 99.89%ね
translation: This is... / That's right. / Even though the constituent materials differ, / the signal arrangement and coordinates / are remarkably similar to human genes. / 99.89%.
grammar: ～あっても - 'even though/if' concessive form of ～ある

text: 99.89%って / 改めて私たちの知恵の / 浅はかさってものを / 思い知らせてくれるわ
translation: 99.89%... / It really makes us realize / the shallowness / of our wisdom.
grammar: ～ってもの - colloquial particle emphasizing the noun. ～てくれる - doing something (for us), benefactive auxiliary

text: これがコアか / 残りはどうだ / それが劣化が激しく資料としては問題が多すぎます / 構わん / 他はすべて破棄だ / はい
translation: So this is the core. / What about the rest? / Well, the deterioration is severe and there are too many problems to use it as research material. / I don't care. / Dispose of everything else. / Yes, sir.

vocabulary.meaning: I don't care, it doesn't matter

grammar: それが - 'well, the thing is...' expressing hesitation or explanation. ～としては - 'as/in terms of'

text: どうしたの? / あ、あ、いえ、別に
translation: What's wrong? / Oh, uh, nothing.
grammar: どうしたの - casual question form. 別に (with implicit negative) = 'nothing in particular'

text: あのね、そういう顔して別にって言われてもね / 気にかけてください、心配してくださいって言われてるようなもんなんですけどね
translation: Look, when you make that face and say 'nothing'... / It's as if you're saying 'Please worry about me, please be concerned,' you know.
grammar: ～て言われても - 'even if you say...'. ～ようなもの - 'like/as if', expressing similarity

text: あの、お父さん手に火傷してるみたいなんだけど / 火傷?
translation: Um, it looks like your father has a burn on his hand. / A burn?
grammar: ～てるみたいなんだけど - 'it seems that..., but...' combining ている + みたい + なんだけど

text: どうしたのかなって思って / 火傷って知ってる?
translation: I was wondering what happened. / Do you know about the burn?
grammar: ～のかなって思って - 'I was thinking/wondering...' quotative って with 思う

text: あなたがまだここに来る前 / 起動実験中に0号機が暴走したの / 聞いてるでしょ / はい
translation: Before you came here / Unit-00 went berserk during an activation test. / You've heard about it, right? / Yes.
grammar: ～でしょ - casual form of ～でしょう, seeking confirmation

text: その時パイロットが中に閉じ込められてね
translation: At that time, the pilot was trapped inside.
grammar: ～られてね - passive form ～られる + casual particle ね for explanation

text: パイロットって綾波ですよね / 怒り司令が彼女を助け出したの
translation: The pilot was Ayanami, right? / Commander Ikari rescued her.
grammar: ～って - casual quotative/topic marker. ～出す - compound verb suffix indicating 'doing completely/thoroughly'

text: 加熱したハッチを無理やりこじ開けてね
translation: He forcibly pried open the heated hatch.
grammar: 無理やり - adverb meaning 'forcibly/by force'

text: 父さんが手のひらのやけどはその時のものよ。
translation: Your father's palm burn is from that time.
grammar: ～のもの - 'the one from...' possessive pattern

text: 何か鈴原って目つ / きやらしい。
translation: Somehow Suzuhara's eyes look / lecherous.
grammar: 何か～って - 'somehow...' using 何か for vague feeling and って for casual quotation

text: どうしてあいついつも一人なんだろうって思ってさ / え?ああ? / ああ、まあ、そない言うたら
translation: I was thinking, why is she always alone? / Eh? Huh? / Ah, well, now that you mention it...
grammar: ～だろうって思って - 'I was thinking that...' quotative って with 思う. Kansai dialect forms そない言うたら

text: 一年の時転校してきたからずっと友達いてないな / なんとなく近寄りがたいんだよ
translation: She transferred in during first year, so she hasn't had friends since then. / Somehow it's hard to approach her.
grammar: ～がたい - 'hard to/difficult to' suffix attached to verb stems. いてない - Kansai dialect negative of いる

text: ほんま性格悪 / いんとちゃうか?
translation: Really bad personality / isn't it?
grammar: Kansai dialect: ほんま (本当), ちゃうか (じゃないか)

text: エヴァのパイロット同士だろ? / シンジが一番よく知ってるんじゃないの? / そりゃそうや
translation: You're both Eva pilots, right? / Shinji would know her best, wouldn't he? / That's true.
grammar: ～だろ - casual masculine form of だろう. ～んじゃないの - negative question 'wouldn't/doesn't...?'

text: ほ、ほとんど口… / 聞かないか
translation: We ha-hardly speak... / Don't you?
grammar: 口を聞く - idiomatic expression 'to speak/talk with someone'

text: CBL循環を開始 / 排液は第二浄水システムへ / 各タンパク壁の状態は良好 / 各部問題なし
translation: Commencing CBL circulation. / Waste fluid to secondary purification system. / All protein wall conditions good. / All sections, no problems.
grammar: Technical/military style speech with noun + を + verb patterns for commands/reports
